sentences: Artikkel oli t채ielikult kirjutatud 체he p채evaga.
See dokument on h채sti kirjutatud ja selge.
context: The word 'kirjutatud' is the past participle form of the Estonian verb 'kirjutama', which means 'to write'. It indicates that something has been written or composed. The '-tud' ending is a common suffix for forming past participles in Estonian, similar to '-ed' in English. This word can be used to describe books, articles, documents, or any text that has been created through writing.
